#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Change Bad Luck
#Text=Have you resorted to knocking on wood or carrying around a rabbit 's foot to change your bad luck ?
#Text=While some people swear by superstitions , there are several things you can do to change your luck .
#Text=Do n't fear black cats and broken mirrors any longer !
#Text=Instead , change your behavior and mindset .
#Text=The good luck will follow you !
#Text=Steps
#Text=Changing Your Behavior
#Text=Relax .
#Text=Learn to release tension on a regular basis .
#Text=Tension keeps you from noticing chance opportunities and experiences .
#Text=Try to reduce the amount of stress in your life .
#Text=To release tension , try meditating , going for a walk , or meeting up with friends .
#Text=If you feel anxious , figure out what 's making you tense .
#Text=For example , if you 're worried about oversleeping and missing the bus for work , make a backup plan .
#Text=Arrange backup transportation in the event that you do oversleep and then stop stressing about it .
#Text=Listen to your intuition .
#Text=By listening to your gut , you 're allowing things to happen without trying to rationally control the outcome .
#Text=This means you 're open to chance opportunities and outcomes .
#Text=Intuition is just one part of allowing chance to change your luck .
#Text=You ca n't completely control events , but you can follow a hunch that might have rewards .
#Text=Change up your routine .
#Text=One of the biggest things you can do to change your luck is to expose yourself to new , chance opportunities .
#Text=If you do the same thing everyday , you 're limiting those opportunities .
#Text=Changing your routine can be as simple as changing your route to work , talking to new people , or meeting up with friends at a new venue .
#Text=Changing your routine may also make you happier , since you 're less likely to become bored with a repetitive routine .
#Text=Random experiences will create new opportunities .
#Text=Avoid social media .
#Text=Constant updates and messages can stress you out , make you feel lonely , and even make you envious .
#Text=Avoiding social media will prevent you from comparing your luck and life with other people 's situations .
#Text=If you find it difficult to stay off of social media , try being active , enjoying nature , learning something new , listening to music , or exercising .
#Text=Changing Your Mindset
#Text=Open your mind to chance opportunities .
#Text=Scientific studies have shown that luckier people have open minds and seek out chance opportunities .
#Text=Chance opportunities are those random encounters that seem to benefit lucky people .
#Text=The good news is that by opening your mind , you 're more aware of the chance opportunities .
#Text=Deal with bad luck .
#Text=Rather than focus on the negative outcome , appreciate any positives .
#Text=For example , if you got into a car accident and needed costly car repairs , focus on how lucky you were to walk away uninjured .
#Text=In doing so , you 're creating your own good luck , simply by changing your outlook .
#Text=On a similar note , be grateful .
#Text=Some studies have shown that reflecting on things you 're grateful for can make you happier and luckier .
#Text=Keep your future expectations high .
#Text=Consider your dreams and set achievable goals to get you closer to meeting them .
#Text=These goals will create opportunities and new experiences which are critical for changing your luck .
#Text=Working toward future goals prevents you from getting stuck in a rut of a routine and exposes you to new people and situations .
#Text=Be optimistic .
#Text=When you 're optimistic , you tend to view things positively , even if it 's an outcome you do n't want .
#Text=In being optimistic , you can view a negative situation in a positive light .
#Text=For example , imagine tripping and breaking your arm .
#Text=An unlucky person would focus on how bad luck made him fall , while a lucky person would instead think how lucky he was that he broke his non-dominant hand .
#Text=Be aware of things that bother you and do something about them .
#Text=Believe that you have the power to change your situation .
#Text=Start by addressing what 's upsetting you and decide what you need to do to feel better about it .
#Text=Whether it 's financial , a relationship , school , or work , realize that you have the ability to turn the issue around positively .
#Text=By changing your problem , realize that you have the power to effect change .
#Text=You 're not subject to the whims of luck or superstition .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Avoid negative or superstitious people .
#Text=Instead , create a positive network that will help you see the good luck in things .
